simpplle.comcode

Class Climate

  • java.lang.Object
    • simpplle.comcode.Climate

  • public class Climate
extends java.lang.Object
    The University of Montana owns copyright of the designated documentation contained within this file as part of the software product designated by Uniform Resource Identifier UM-OpenSIMPPLLE-1.0. By copying this file the user accepts the University of Montana Open Source License Contract pertaining to this documentation and agrees to abide by all restrictions, requirements, and assertions contained therein. All Other Rights Reserved.

    This class has methods pertaining to climate. The main categories are Season, Moisture, Temperature. The seasons are spring, summer, fall, winter, year.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Climate.Moisture

      static class  Climate.Temperature

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Climate()
      constructor - initializes the TreeMap to store user values, Temperature [][] and Moisture [][], and a new random variable maker Then calls initProbs which sets all temperature and moisture for seasons to normal

    • Constructor Detail

      • Climate

        public Climate()
        constructor - initializes the TreeMap to store user values, Temperature [][] and Moisture [][], and a new random variable maker Then calls initProbs which sets all temperature and moisture for seasons to normal

    • Method Detail

      • initProbs

        private void initProbs()
        initialize probablities. outer loop goes through all the seasons, inner loop sets the temperature and moisture for all season to normal

      • allNonUserNormal

        public void allNonUserNormal()
        will set any moisture or temperature value not input by user to NORMAL

      • randomizeClimate

        public void randomizeClimate()
        calls pickNewValues to put randomized values into the temperature and moisture arrays for each season in spots where user values are not stored.

      • pickNewValues

        private void pickNewValues(int tStep,
                 Climate.Season season)
        method to create random temperature and moisture conditions for
        Parameters:
        tStep - the time step
        season - from season enumeration.

        public static Climate.Temperature[] getAllTemperatures()

        Returns:

        public static Climate.Temperature getDefaultTemperature()

        Returns:
        normal temperature

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • getTemperature

        public Climate.Temperature getTemperature()
        gets temperature from current simulation
        Returns:
        temperature of current simulation, if simulation is null returns default temperature = NORMAL

      • getTemperature

        public Climate.Temperature getTemperature(Climate.Season season)
        overloaded getTemperature function - passes to getTemerature( int, Season)
        Parameters:
        season - in which temperature is to be gotten from based on current time step
        Returns:
        for a running simulation returns the temperature at current time step within season parameter, if no simulation returns default temperature = NORMAL

      • getTemperature

        public Climate.Temperature getTemperature(int tStep,
                                 Climate.Season season)
        overloaded getTemperature function. temperature from temperature [][] for season
        Parameters:
        tStep - current simulation time step
        season - current simulation season
        Returns:
        returns temperature from temperature [][] for season - from enumeration, and time step

        uses enum to get string name of temperature condition
        Parameters:
        temp - from temperature enum
        Returns:
        name of temperature condition in uppercase

      • getMoisture

        public Climate.Moisture getMoisture()
        Gets moisture from currrent simulation for the current season. If simulation is null return default Moisture. Choices are WETTER, NORMAL, DRIER.
        Returns:
        Moisture

      • getMoisture

        public Climate.Moisture getMoisture(Climate.Season season)
        Gets season moisture condition from moisture enum for current time step. Choices are WETTER, NORMAL, DRIER
        Parameters:
        season - the current season passed
        Returns:
        moisture condition of current simulation by current season unless simulation is null and then defaults to NORMAL

      • getMoisture

        public Climate.Moisture getMoisture(int tStep,
                           Climate.Season season)
        overloaded getMoisture function
        Parameters:
        tStep - time step
        season - current simulation season
        Returns:
        the moisture from moisture [][] indexed by Season enum ordinal and current time step.

      • getMoistureId

        private Climate.Moisture getMoistureId(java.lang.String str)
        Parameters:
        str - name of moisture condition
        Returns:
        id in enum of parameter moisture condition

      • getMoistureStr

        private java.lang.String getMoistureStr(Climate.Moisture moisture)
        Gets moisture string from moisture enum. Choices are WETTER, NORMAL, DRIER
        Parameters:
        moisture - requested moisture condition
        Returns:
        name of moisture condition in uppercase

      • addClimate

        public void addClimate(int tStep,
              Climate.Season season)
        Initializes a climate arraylist with all seasons. adds to userValues keyed by time step
        Parameters:
        tStep - time step is key into userValue mapping
        season - if YEAR will initialize a climate arrayList,

        if null will create ArrayList for season and map the userValues to the time step and null season

        if season arraylist does not contain the parameter season, will add the season to arrayList and mark changed.

      • setTemperature

        public void setTemperature(int tStep,
                  Climate.Season season,
                  java.lang.String str)
        takes a string name of temperature condition turns to temperarureID and passes to overloaded setTemperature function
        Parameters:
        tStep - time step
        season -
        str - name of condition to be turned to ordinal and used as temperatureID

      • setTemperature

        public void setTemperature(int tStep,
                  Climate.Season season,
                  Climate.Temperature value)
        overloaded setTemperature function. sets the temperature [season][time step] to the season and time step if season = YEAR, will set the temperature [season] [time step] to the temperatureID for all seasons in enum
        Parameters:
        tStep - time step
        season - from Season enum choices are SPRING, SUMMER, FALL, WINTER, YEAR
        value - temperatureID value

      • setMoisture

        public void setMoisture(int tStep,
               Climate.Season season,
               java.lang.String str)
        Sets the moisture at a particular time step, season and moisture string (used to get ordinal into Moisture Enum
        Parameters:
        tStep - time step
        season - season to be set
        str - the string to be used to get the ordinal MoistureID

      • setMoisture

        public void setMoisture(int tStep,
               Climate.Season season,
               Climate.Moisture value)
        overloaded setMoisture function. sets the moisture [season] [timestep] to moistureID value If season = YEAR will set the [season] [time step] for all seasons to the moistureID
        Parameters:
        tStep - time step
        season - season in which the moisture value will be set
        value - the moistureID value

      • removeClimate

        public void removeClimate(int tStep,
                 Climate.Season season)
        removes a specific time step of climate in userValues map either by removing the season, time step - if no corresponding season, or by setting moisture and temperature to NORMAL
        Parameters:
        tStep - time step
        season -

      • removeAllClimate

        public void removeAllClimate(int tStep)
        removes all climate information for a given time step by setting the temperature[][] and moisture [][] to the default NORMAL, then removes the timestep from UserValue map
        Parameters:
        tStep -

      • removeAll

        public void removeAll()
        sets all indexes in temperature []][]and moisture[][] to the default temperature and moisture - NORMAL then clears the userValue map

      • closeFile

        public void closeFile()
        Closes climate file. Sets all indexes in temperature []][]and moisture[][] to the default temperature and moisture - NORMAL then clears the userValue map Clears the Climate file and sets changed to false.

      • isUserClimate

        public boolean isUserClimate(int tStep)
        Checks if a particular time step has a user input climate.
        Parameters:
        tStep - time step
        Returns:
        true if climate at time step is a user value.

      • isUserClimate

        public boolean isUserClimate(int tStep,
                    Climate.Season season)
        Gets the user seasons by using the parameter time step to get the ArrayList of seasons from the user values tree map > then checking if the parameter season is contained in it.
        Parameters:
        tStep - to get the ArrayList of seasons from the user values tree map
        season - season being checked
        Returns:
        true if season is in the user values tree map

      • userScheduleClimateExists

        public boolean userScheduleClimateExists()
        Checks if user scheduled climate exists.
        Returns:
        True if there is a climate object in the user values arraylist.

      • getFirstTimeStep

        public int getFirstTimeStep()
        gets the first time step. checks for null or size ==0
        Returns:
        if null or size ==0 returns -1, else returns the first time step

        Returns:

      • getPrevUserSeason

        public Climate.Season getPrevUserSeason(int timeStep,
                               Climate.Season currentSeason)
        Gets the previous user season by first using the parameter time step to get the ArrayList of seasons from the user values tree map > then using the parameter current season variable -1 to index into ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        timeStep - used to get season ArrayList
        currentSeason - Subtract 1 to get the previous.
        Returns:
        returns previous user season

      • getNextUserSeason

        public Climate.Season getNextUserSeason(int timeStep,
                               Climate.Season currentSeason)
        Gets the previous user season by first using the parameter time step to get the ArrayList of seasons from the user values tree map > then using the parameter current season variable + 1 to index into ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        timeStep - used to get season ArrayList
        currentSeason - Add 1 to get the previous.
        Returns:
        if index is -1 or season is the last one in index returns null, else returns next season

        Returns:

        Calculates Climate object is a wet climate instance.
        Returns:
        true if moisture of current simulation and current season is WETTER

        Calculates if time step instance is a drought
        Parameters:
        tStep - time step
        Returns:
        true if moisture of current simulation and current season is WETTER
